private_information: I can only pick and place blocks whose labels are vowels. In this task the vowel blocks are: A, E, I.
I can only interact with blocks that are clear (top of a stack).
I can move only one block at a time and I can place a block either on the table or on top of another clear block.
vowel_agent.goal: Collaborate to reconfigure the stacks so the final single stack has A on B, B on C, C on D, D on E, E on F, F on G, G on H, H on I, I on J, J on K, K on L, L on M, M on N, with N on the table.

private_information: I can only pick and place blocks whose labels are consonants. In this task the consonant blocks are: B, C, D, F, G, H, J, K, L, M, N.
I can only interact with blocks that are clear (top of a stack).
I can move only one block at a time and I can place a block either on the table or on top of another clear block.
consonant_agent.goal: Collaborate to reconfigure the stacks so the final single stack has A on B, B on C, C on D, D on E, E on F, F on G, G on H, H on I, I on J, J on K, K on L, L on M, M on N, with N on the table.

orchestrator.goal: Produce a unified PDDL domain and PDDL problem suitable for the FastDownwards planner that encodes the blocksworld reconfiguration task and the agent capability constraints so a joint plan can be found.

public_information: There are 14 uniquely labeled blocks: A B C D E F G H I J K L M N.
Blocks are arranged in stacks on a table. Each stack is ordered bottom to top.
Only blocks that are clear (top of a stack) can be moved and only one block can be moved at a time.
An agent may place a moved block either on the table or on top of another clear block.
One agent may interact only with vowel-labeled blocks; the other may interact only with consonant-labeled blocks.
Initial stacks bottom-to-top are: [K, H, N, M, J, A], [I, D, B], [G, L, E], [C, F].
Goal: form a single stack with N on the table and above it M, L, K, J, I, H, G, F, E, D, C, B, A with A as the topmost block.

model.system_prompt: You are vowel_agent. Provide a concise capability model and local constraints describing which primitive pick and place operations you can perform given the public information. Do not emit PDDL. Focus on: the set of blocks you can move, preconditions for moves (clear, top), allowed targets (table or clear blocks), and any limitations you need the orchestrator to consider.
model.prompt: You are vowel_agent. Here is the public information: {environment->public_information}. Here is your private information: {agents->vowel_agent->private_information}. Here is the global goal: {agents->vowel_agent->goal}. Produce a concise, structured description of your capabilities and any assumptions you require the orchestrator to respect. Output should describe which blocks you can move, what you consider a legal move, and any additional observations about the initial stack top blocks you can act upon.

model.system_prompt: You are consonant_agent. Provide a concise capability model and local constraints describing which primitive pick and place operations you can perform given the public information. Do not emit PDDL. Focus on: the set of blocks you can move, preconditions for moves (clear, top), allowed targets (table or clear blocks), and any limitations you need the orchestrator to consider.
model.prompt: You are consonant_agent. Here is the public information: {environment->public_information}. Here is your private information: {agents->consonant_agent->private_information}. Here is the global goal: {agents->consonant_agent->goal}. Produce a concise, structured description of your capabilities and any assumptions you require the orchestrator to respect. Output should describe which blocks you can move, what you consider a legal move, and any additional observations about the initial stack top blocks you can act upon.

pddl.system_prompt: You are orchestrator. Produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file targeted at the FastDownwards planner. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. The domain must encode blocks as objects, predicates for on, on-table, clear, holding if needed, and actions for pickup and place. Actions must respect that only top-of-stack (clear) blocks can be moved and that the two agents have disjoint move capabilities (vowels vs consonants). Keep the actions of the two agents distinct in the domain or annotate actions to indicate which agent can execute them. Use types or action constraints to reflect agent-specific permissions. Do not invent additional blocks or change block labels. If the agent models are partial, integrate them conservatively and document any assumptions in comments within the PDDL comments.
pddl.prompt: You are orchestrator. Here is the public information: {environment->public_information}. Here is the orchestrator goal: {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Here is the capability description reported by the vowel agent: {model_vowel_agent}. Here is the capability description reported by the consonant agent: {model_consonant_agent}. Integrate these descriptions and produce a PDDL domain and PDDL problem targeted at FastDownwards that encode the initial stacks and the goal single stack with N on the table and A at the top. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Ensure agent-specific actions remain distinct and that move preconditions enforce top-only moves. If you must state any assumptions to complete the encoding, include them as comments in the PDDL.
